meanings.definition: Emit energy in the form of waves or particles
meanings.sent1: The sun can radiate warmth to make us feel cozy.
meanings.sent2: The light bulbs radiate light in all directions.
meanings.sent3: The campfire seemed to radiate a magical glow.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could radiate happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The heater radiates heat evenly across the room.

meanings.definition: Spread out from a central point
meanings.sent1: The spokes of the wheel radiate outwards from the hub.
meanings.sent2: The ripples radiate across the surface of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The laughter radiated from the group of friends.
meanings.sent4: The roads radiate from the city center like spokes on a wheel.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread radiates from the bakery.

meanings.definition: Show a feeling or quality through one's actions or appearance
meanings.sent1: Her kindness radiates through her words and gestures.
meanings.sent2: Confidence can radiate from a person's posture.
meanings.sent3: The excitement radiated from the children waiting for the show.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music radiates in every note he plays.
meanings.sent5: The pride in her work radiates from her beaming smile.
